question: Which of the following places is not associated with the growth of art?
explanation:
Mahabalipuram is a historic city and UNESCO World Heritage site in Tamil Nadu. During the reign of the Pallava dynasty, between the 3rd century CE and 7th century CE, it became an important centre of art, architecture and literature.
Amarnath cave is a Hindu shrine located in Jammu and Kashmir, India. The Amarnath yatra attracts lakhs of pilgrims every year who visit the site during Shravani Mela in July-August.
The Ajanta caves include paintings and rock-cut sculptures described as among the finest surviving examples of ancient Indian art, particularly expressive paintings that present emotion through gesture, pose and form.
Ellora caves are located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra. These caves features Buddhist, Hindu and Jain monuments, and artwork which dates back from the 600â€“1000 CE period.
